title: NASA preparing for late September Artemis 1 launch attempt
summary: NASA is laying the groundwork for another attempt to launch the Space Launch System on the Artemis 1 mission late this month, pending both repairs to leaking liquid hydrogen lines and negotiations with the Eastern Range.

title: Solid rocket startup Adranos opens fuel-production facility in Indiana
summary: Adranos, a startup that manufactures solid rocket motors, announced Sept. 8 it opened a fuel-production facility in Indiana.

title: Blue Canyon delivers first satellite bus for DARPA’s Blackjack constellation
summary: Blue Canyon Technologies delivered the first of 10 satellite buses DARPA ordered in 2020 for its Blackjack experiment in low Earth orbit.

title: NASA discusses path to SLS repairs as launch uncertainty looms for September, October
summary: NASA and SLS program managers have developed part of a forward plan for addressing the significant liquid hydrogen (LH2) leak that was observed during the Saturday, September 3 attempt to launch the SLS rocket and the Artemis I mission from LC-39B at the Kennedy Space Center.

title: Apple to be largest user of Globalstar’s satellite network for iPhone messaging
summary: Apple formally announced its long-anticipated partnership with Globalstar Sept. 7 to provide satellite messaging services for new iPhones and becoming Globalstar’s biggest customer.

title: NASA selects Axiom Space to develop Artemis spacesuit
summary: NASA awarded a $228.5 million task order to Axiom Space to develop a spacesuit to be used on the first Artemis landing mission, although the design of the suit remains under wraps.

title: Ariane 5 launches Konnect VHTS satellite for Eutelsat
summary: Arianespace launched the 6.5-ton Konnect VHTS satellite for Eutelsat Sept. 7 to improve broadband coverage in Europe.

title: SpaceX, Firefly Aerospace targeting three rocket launches in two days
summary: SpaceX and Firefly Aerospace are on track to attempt three orbital launches this weekend as the former continues to relentlessly assemble a...

title: NASA officials evaluating late September launch dates for Artemis 1 moon mission
summary: NASA officials said Thursday they hope to try again to launch the Artemis 1 moon rocket from the Kennedy Space Center as soon as Sept. 23 or 27, but that schedule comes with two big caveats: A repair to a leaky liquid hydrogen fueling line must hold tight during a tanking test next weekend, and the Space Force’s Eastern Range has to extend the certification of batteries on the moon rocket’s flight safety system.

title: SpaceX Starship prototype ignites six engines, starts major brush fire
summary: SpaceX has successfully ignited all six engines on its latest Starship prototype, taking a significant step towards ensuring that the upper stage...
